mainHero.title: Welcome to the Wedding of
mainHero.subtitle: Agata & Thomas
mainHero.description: On June 28th, 2025, we will be celebrating our love in Bydgoszcz, at the stunning Boska Wenecja, located in the heart of the city. This website will provide you with all the information you need to join us as we begin this new chapter of our lives together. We look forward to showing you what Bydgoszcz has to offer.

items.title: Ceramony location
items.description: The ceramony will be taking place at the Bydgoszcz civil registry office location at Sielanka 8A, 85-073 Bydgoszcz.

items.title: Reception location
items.description:
After the ceramony we will convene at Boska Wenecja where the party will take place, located at Poznańska 8/14, 85-129 Bydgoszcz. 

 Remeber to bring your dancing shoes :)

accommodation.title: Bydgoszcz
accommodation.subtitle: Hotels & Accomodation
accommodation.description: Bydgoszcz has plenty of places to stay ranging from budget hotels, hostels, luxury hotels and AirBnB's, many of which are located in a walking distance to the wedding venue. Below you'll find a list of recommendations nearby.

items.name: Rezydencja Sowa
items.description: Sowa Residence is located in the heart of the Old Town, in the immediate vicinity of the most notable monuments of the city and the Brda River.

items.name: La Mare Housebouts
items.description: Dom Na Wodzie La Mare Houseboat offers a unique riverside retreat in the heart of Bydgoszcz, just steps from the Opera Nova Conference Centre and Town Hall. From the private terrace, you'll be looking straight out onto the central river view of Bydgoszcz.

items.name: Stara Drukarnia
items.description: Stara Drukarnia rents out studio apartments at affordable prices. The apartments are location a 15 min walk from the wedding venue.

gifts.title: Gifts
gifts.subTitle: Wishlist
gifts.description:
Dear friends and family, here’s our plea, We’re dreaming of Turkey’s skies to see. A hot air balloon, so high, so bright, Would make our honeymoon pure delight.

If you’d like to help us take this flight, A little cash would feel just right. And instead of flowers, sweet and fair, coffee beans show how much you care.

With your sweet gift, we’ll toast to you, Each morning fresh, with a lovely brew!

menu.title: Menu
menu.subTitle: Culinary Delights from Two Cultures
menu.description:
We'll be sharing a feast of modern Polish cuisine wtih you. Aditionally, we'll have some snacks from both Denmark and Poland, along with sparkling and non-sparkling wine, local craft beer and an assortment of sodas. 
Vegan and glutenfree options are available, though please let us know before hand so we can inform the restaurant.

thingsToDo.title: Bydgoszcz
thingsToDo.subTitle: What to see and what to do

items.name: Cutting of the socks and tie
items.description: In danish tradition at the end of the bridal dance the male guests are to lift up the groom, take off his shoes, and cut a hole in his sock, and cut off his tie. There is of course no ill intent in this (but boys please, practice your steady hands). This tradition is to symoblise that the groom is no longer a bachelor, and therefore no longer needs to impress potential partners with his outfit. Certain sources also claim it is the first `task` for the bride to fix the socks afterwards, but we all know Thomas is perfectly capable of fixing his own damn socks
